articles.title: More Provincial Meetings for WPK Conference Held
articles.content:
More Provincial Meetings for WPK Conference Held
 Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- Meetings of WPK delegates of Jagang and Ryanggang provinces for the election of delegates to the WPK conference were held on August 28, according to Rodong Sinmun Friday.
					 Attending the meetings were delegates elected at provincial, city and county party committees and party organizations of units at different levels.
					
					 The meetings discussed the issue on the election of delegates to the WPK conference.
					
					Speeches proposing the election of General Secretary Kim Jong Il as delegate to the party conference were made by Kim Chun Sop, secretary of Jagang Provincial Committee of the WPK who is delegate of the party organization of the Jagang Provincial Committee of the WPK at the Jagang Provincial meeting and by Kim Hi Thaek, chief secretary of the Ryanggang Provincial Committee of the WPK who is delegate of the party organization of the Ryanggang Provincial People's Committee at the Ryanggang Provincial meeting.
					
					 They said that Kim Jong Il is the supreme representative of the WPK, a symbol of the dignity and glory of the country and the nation and an invincible banner of the army and people of the DPRK, stressing that he has led the party and revolution to victory for a long period, performing feats to shine long in the history of Kim Il Sung's nation.
					
					 After unfolding a grand blueprint for building a thriving socialist nation Kim Jong Il has made a guerrilla-style forced march to every nook and corner of the country with indomitable mental power and superhuman will, recording a heroic epic of patriotic devotion, they said, and continued:
					
					 Under his leadership revolutionary battle sites and historic sites were successfully spruced up to make a great contribution to the education in the revolutionary traditions, a great many minor power stations and light industrial establishments sprang up in different parts of the country to help improve the standard of people's living.
					
					 They courteously proposed electing Kim Jong Il as delegate to the WPK conference, reflecting the unanimous desire of all party members and other people of the province.
					
					 The speakers fully supported and approved the proposal.
					
					 Decisions on electing Kim Jong Il as delegate to the WPK conference were adopted by an unanimous approval at the meetings.

articles.title: Chinese Ambassador Hosts Reception
articles.content:
Chinese Ambassador Hosts Reception
 Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Liu Hongcai arranged a reception at his embassy on Friday on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the victory in the anti-Japanese war.
					 Present there on invitation were Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Pak Ui Chun, minister of Foreign Affairs, Choe Chang Sik, minister of Public Health who doubles as chairman of the Central Committee of the DPRK-China Friendship Association, and others and anti-Japanese revolutionary fighters and officials concerned.
					
					 The ambassador said in his speech that the Korean revolutionaries led by President Kim Il Sung recorded together with Chinese comrades a brilliant epic in the struggle against the Japanese aggressors.
					
					He noted that General Secretary Kim Jong Il paid an unofficial visit to China at a time when the traditional Sino-Korean friendship is greeting a new phase after standing all tests of history.
					
					 The Chinese side together with the DPRK side will firmly protect and develop the Sino-DPRK friendly and cooperative relations and carry forward the blood-sealed deep friendship and thus bring welfare to the peoples of the two countries and positively contribute to preserving peace, stability and progress in the region, he stressed.
					
					 Pak Ui Chun said in his speech that President Kim Il Sung together with Chinese revolutionaries of the elder generation made long journeys of bloody anti-Japanese struggle, thus providing a brilliant history and excellent tradition of the DPRK-China friendship.
					
					The historic China visit paid by lKim Jong Il again provided an occasion of demonstrating internally and externally that the friendly relations between the two countries are unbreakable even under the complicated situation and twists and turns as it was a landmark event of weighty significance in boosting the DPRK-China friendship, he noted.
					
					 We will as ever continue to make efforts with Chinese comrades to develop on a higher level the traditional DPRK-China friendly relations forged in the crucible of the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle, he stressed.

articles.title: National Art Exhibition Opens
articles.content:
National Art Exhibition Opens
 Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- A national art exhibition opened with due ceremony at the Pyongyang Indoor Stadium on Friday to greet the conference of the Workers' Party of Korea and the 65th anniversary of its founding.
					 On display in the venue are more than 400 art works including Korean paintings, oil paintings, sculptures, jewel-powdered paintings, handicraft, embroideries and calligraphic works dealing with the great revolutionary exploits performed by the great persons of Mt. Paektu recorded in the sacred annals of the WPK and the heroic struggle of the army and people of the DPRK who performed miracles and exploits, united close around the Party, etc.
					
					 Sculpture "The great leader proclaiming the founding of the WPK", Korean painting "Putting forward them as masters of the Hwanghae Iron Works" and other works represent the immortal exploits performed by President Kim Il Sung in building the Party and his noble popular traits.
					
					Also on display are Korean paintings and oil paintings and other works dealing with the personality of General Secretary Kim Jong Il as a great man who has developed the WPK into a powerful staff of the revolution and a genuine mother party and trained the People's Army as a matchless revolutionary army of Mt. Paektu with his outstanding leadership art and the noble traits of anti-Japanese heroine Kim Jong Suk who dedicated her all to the country and its people.
					
					 Displayed there are art works dealing with the army and people of the DPRK dashing ahead like the wind, bringing about great innovations and leap forward to build a thriving nation of Juche as early as possible, and the people enjoying all blessings of socialism under the care of the Party.
					
					 Present at the opening ceremony were Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the Central Committee of the WPK, Vice-Premier Kang Nung Su, An Tong Chun, minister of Culture, officials concerned, art creators and working people and youth and students in Pyongyang.
					
					 Kim Ki Nam made an inaugural speech.
					
					 The participants looked round the art works on display.

articles.title: Koguryo Tomb with Murals Discovered
articles.content:
Koguryo Tomb with Murals Discovered
 Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- Researchers of the Archaeological Institute of the Academy of Social Sciences of the DPRK recently discovered a Koguryo tomb with murals unique in its style believed to belong to late in the 4th century or early in the 5th century in the area of Tongsan-dong, Raknang District, Pyongyang.
					 The earth-covered stone tomb 12.8 meters in length and 2~2.4 meters in width extends north and south. It has an inner passage, a front section, two rooms on its left and right sides, a passage between rooms, an inner section and others.
					
					 The front section is 240 centimeters in length, 210 centimeters in width and 330 centimeters in height. The size of each room on the left and right sides of the tomb is 80 centimeters in length, 72 centimeters in width and 115 centimeters in height. Their ceilings are supported with vaulted triangular props and parallel triangular props.
					
					 Unearthed in the tomb were bones of three persons, petal and dome style ornaments made of pure gold, circular silver ornaments, jagged gilt-bronze ornaments, coffin nails, pottery, lion-shaped celadon, bronze coins and others.
					
					 A picture of long procession is seen on both walls of the inner passage and red pillars, a custodian leader and various other patterns are done in relief on the walls of the front section, passage between rooms and the inner section.
					
					 Depicted above the painting showing the long procession are five persons and four horses, the body and legs of an iron-clad horse in its middle and only part of a man's head is seen over it.
					
					 Portrayed in its lower part are men with dark coifs on their heads carrying things like long spears with them. 
					
					 Seen on the western wall of the inner passage are a wheel and a man on a horse. Very vivid are the eyes and mustache of the man wearing an official's headgear and horse's mane. 
					
					 The tomb was built by way of alternately mixing lime, charcoal and clay with each other which is distinct from other tombs.
					
					 This tomb is comparatively large in size and peculiar in its style, when compared with other Koguryo mural tombs known so far.

articles.title: DPRK Wins Gold in Taekwon-do Championships
articles.content:
DPRK Wins Gold in Taekwon-do Championships
 Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- The DPRK proved successful in the 9th Junior and the 4th Veteran Taekwon-do World Championships. 
					 In the junior championships the DPRK bagged 14 gold medals, two silver medals and three bronze medals and came first in the total standings to win a trophy.
					
					 The Korean players placed first in men's and women's team pattern competitions, women's team sparring matches and women's team exhibitions for special skills.
					
					 Ra Kyong Hun took the men's A Class pattern individual title, Kim Kyong Myong the men's C Class pattern individual title and Ri Ra Ryong the men's self-defense competitions title. 
					
					 Kim Kum Jong came first in the women's sparring individual (40kg) and women's self-defense competitions, Kim Yong Gyong, Kim Ji Hyang and Kim Hyang Sim each in the women's A Class, B Class and C Class pattern individuals. Kim Su Ryon won gold medal in the women's individual sparring (70kg) and Kim Il Hwa in the women's individual sparring (over 70kg). 
					
					 Male and female overall champions were awarded to Ra Kyong Hun and Kim Kum Jong. 
					
					 The DPRK also took the first place in total standings of the veteran championships.
					
					 Pak Un Ho emerged winner in the men's C Class pattern individual and Kim Jong Sun in the women's A Class pattern individual and sparring (68kg).
					
					 Kim Jong Sun was awarded the female overall champion of the veteran championships.

articles.title: Rose Beds Come Out in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Rose Beds Come Out in Pyongyang
Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- Rose beds have presented themselves along streets of Pyongyang, adding to the beauty of the city.
					 Rambler and other species of roses have been adapted to the climatic and soil conditions of the country by the Pyongyang Floricultural Research Center.
					
					 Ku Kyong Sun, a section chief of the Horticultural Department of the Pyongyang City People's Committee, told KCNA that thousands of roses had taken root in round flowerbeds of rotaries and in Kwangbok, Thongil and other streets of the city.
					
					 The department formed rose workteams in district horticultural stations and fully settled problems arising in the propagation of roses and their manuring and cultivation.
					
					 It also sponsored a workshop to help horticulturists and other people learn of the roses' biological character and tend them on a scientific and technological basis.
					
					 It has paid priority to supplying their saplings to horticultural stations in time, while dispatching experts to them to give technical assistance.
					
					 With the appearance of rose beds, Pyongyang streets have become more beautiful.

articles.title: Kyongwon County Lush with Trees
articles.content:
Kyongwon County Lush with Trees
 Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- Kyongwon County of North Hamgyong Province, the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, is thick with trees.
					 High poplars are growing densely along the Tuman River, mountains and hills are thickly covered with wood and factories, farms, streets, villages and all other places of the county sheltered by foliage.
					
					 The people of the county have made strenuous effort to bring about a great change in afforestation, true to the intention of the Workers' Party of Korea to turn the country into a woodland and greenery.
					
					 After launching a tree planting campaign with sixteen poplar twigs of a new species some two decades ago, the county built a tree nursery covering over 30 hectares, giving priority to cultivating saplings.
					
					The county produced more than 100,000 saplings in Juche 90 (2001) and, since then, 200,000-300,000 every year to plant along roads, in compounds of industrial establishments and schools and in mountains and hills.
					
					 New species of trees have also been planted in some 400 hectares along the River Tuman.
					
					 Meanwhile, a tree-tending system has been set up on a mass scale to keep them from any damage.  
					
					 As the result, the county has turned into a picturesque land and enjoyed benefits from the trees with poplars used as paper material. 
					
					 Poplar growing in the county is called Kyongwon Poplar. It has been propagated throughout the country.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak's Cabinet Reshuffle Termed Hypocritical
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak's Cabinet Reshuffle Termed Hypocritical 
 Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- In the Cabinet reshuffle traitor Lee Myung Bak allowed Minister of Unification Hyon In Thaek, Minister of Foreign Affairs and Trade Ryu Myong Hwan, Minister of Defence Kim Thae Yong and Director of the Intelligence Service Won Se Hun of south Korea who are cursed by all the Koreans as the "four traitors of 2010" to stay in office. This brings to light his ulterior intention to continue rushing headlong into dependence on outside forces and escalation of confrontation with fellow countrymen. 
					 Minju Joson Friday observes in a signed commentary:
					
					 Lee claimed that the reshuffle was aimed to deepen the "understanding with the people", but this was no more than a downright lie intended to mislead the public opinion. 
					
					 The commentary cites facts to prove that his new confidants are those repeatedly charged with irregularities and corruption without exception. 
					
					 "Understanding with the people" much touted by Lee means self-opinionated and arbitrary practices going against the public mind-set.  
					
					 What should not be overlooked is that the traitor let loose a spate of outbursts urging his new confidants to take the lead in building "a fair society". It is as clear as noonday that those hell-bent on irregularities and corruption can never build "a fair society". His loud-mouthed "fair society" is nothing but wordplay to calm down the criticism of the recent Cabinet reshuffle.
					
					 Lee seeks to placate the angry public with such high-sounding words as "understanding with people" and "a fair society" and enforce an unpopular rule through his new confidants by relying on outside forces and escalating the confrontation with fellow countrymen in his remaining term of office. The day is not far off when traitor Lee and his confidants will face a stern judgment from the people.

articles.title: All Koreans Called upon to Eliminate Pro-Japanese Lackeys
articles.content:
All Koreans Called upon to Eliminate Pro-Japanese Lackeys
 Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- It is impossible to protect the dignity and sovereignty of the nation, force the Japanese reactionaries to redeem their crime-woven past and foil the Japanese militarists' moves to stage a comeback to Korea as long as such pro-Japanese sycophantic and treacherous group as the Lee Myung Bak group of south Korea is allowed to remain in power, observes Rodong Sinmun Friday in a signed article. 
					 It goes on:
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries are sharpening their swords to revive militarism, persistently denying Japanese imperialists' blood-stained history of aggression, exploitation, massacre and maltreatment. This is a hideous crime as it infringes upon the dignity and sovereignty of the DPRK, challenges the history and justice and wantonly violates human ethics and morality.
					
					 What matters is that among the Koreans there is a group of wicked pro-Japanese sycophants and lackeys defending and encouraging such criminal acts of militarist Japan.
					
					 It is only two and a half years since the Lee Myung Bak group came to power but they committed bigger and more intolerable sycophancy and treachery to serve Japan than any preceding ruling quarters perpetrated in the whole period of their office. 
					
					 Nothing is more hateful than the acts of the puppet group of south Korea selling off the nation's dignity and sovereignty to the Japanese reactionaries.
					
					 Equally intolerable are the group's treacherous acts of frantically stepping up the moves to escalate the confrontation with the DPRK in collusion with its Japanese master. 
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak group is one of betes noires for the Koreans and modern day "five traitors of 1905" as it is busy infringing upon the dignity and sovereignty of the nation, persistently seeking to stifle compatriots and helping militarist Japan stage a comeback to Korea in league with it.
					
					 It is necessary to eliminate the above-said sycophants and traitors from south Korea as early as possible in order to protect the dignity and sovereignty of the nation, safeguard the country's peace and achieve national reunification.

articles.title: All People Called upon to Learn from Pro-reunification Patriotic Fighters
articles.content:
All People Called upon to Learn from Pro-reunification Patriotic Fighters 
 Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- All the people should more dynamically accelerate the general advance for the Songun revolution under the leadership of Kim Jong Il, keeping deep in their minds the spirit of devotedly defending the leader, the confidence in sure victory and optimism just as the pro-reunification patriotic fighters did. Rodong Sinmun Friday urges this in an editorial dedicated to the 10th anniversary of the repatriation of the former unconverted long-term prisoners strong in faith and will.
					 It goes on:
					
					 Ten years since the repatriation of the unconverted long-term prisoners were the period that proved the truth of revolution that the noble self-sacrificing struggle waged by the revolutionaries and patriots for the country and the nation was not in vain but is sure to shine long.
					
					 The reality in which those prisoners repatriated to the north at the same time and came to enjoy the happiest life patently proves that the DPRK is the genuine motherland for the revolutionaries and people and the cradle of loving care and benevolence which they should defend to the last, always entrusting their destiny and future to it.
					
					Recalling that General Secretary Kim Jong Il valued and embraced them, bestowing upon them the greatest glory and happiness, the editorial noted that this legend-like story will always go down in the noble history of comradeship of the Korean revolution.
					
					 The struggle and life of the above-said prisoners teach truth that only highest honor, happiness and a worthy life are in store for the revolutionary soldiers only when they have firm faith in their leaders and remain true to their cause to the last. 
					
					 The editorial calls on all the party members and other working people to devotedly defend Kim Jong Il and share the idea and desire with him just as the unconverted long-term prisoners undauntedly struggled, picturing to themselves President             Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il only awake or asleep, though left all alone on an isolated island, and make a long journey for the Songun revolution to the last.

articles.title: US Accused of Pressurizing S. Korea to Cover Upkeep for Its Forces
articles.content:
US Accused of Pressurizing S. Korea to Cover Upkeep for Its Forces
 Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification of south Korea held a 104th rally for peace and disarmament outside the puppet Ministry of Defense on August 31, accusing the U.S. of pressurizing south Korea to cover the expense for the transfer of the U.S. military bases.
					 Speakers at the rally charged that the U.S. is pressurizing south Korea to cover the upkeep of its forces with the taxes collected from the south Korean people though it was obliged to bear the expense for the transfer of the base of its second division. It accused the U.S. of mulling specifying this in a document to be adopted at the annual security consultative meeting slated to take place in future.
					
					 They deplored that south Korean people had already expressed concern over the fact that south Korea would come under the burden of covering all the expenses for the transfer of the U.S. military bases pursuant to its new war strategy and this became a reality.
					
					 They called upon the people from all walks of life to positively turn out in the struggle against the pressure upon south Korea to bear the expense for the transfer of the U.S. military bases and the expansion of the U.S. forces base in Phyongthaek.

articles.title: Settlement of Issue of Assisting Korean Schools in Japan Urged
articles.content:
Settlement of Issue of Assisting Korean Schools in Japan Urged
 Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- Koreans in Japan and Japanese people are continuing their actions in different parts of Japan in demand of the application on an equal footing of the tuition-free program to Korean schools in Japan.
					Representatives of a Korean school in Aichi Prefecture and Japanese citizens conveyed a signature paper endorsed by more than 19,300 people to the Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology of Japan on August 24, demanding the prompt application of the tuition-free program to Korean schools.
					
					 Earlier on August 10, Korean and Japanese poets visited the ministry to urge the Japanese government to come out for a solution to the issue of assisting Korean schools.
					
					 They pointed out that the most vicious one of the crimes committed by Japan during its colonial rule over Korea was the policy of throttling Korean and enforcing use of Japanese.
					
					 It is quite natural for the descendants of those who were forcibly taken to Japan, to learn their native language, they said, stating that it is unreasonable to exclude only the students of Korean schools from the tuition-free program.
					
					They demanded that the Japanese government pay aid funds to Korean schools without discrimination.

articles.title: US-S. Korea Joint Military Exercises Denounced
articles.content:
US-S. Korea Joint Military Exercises Denounced
 Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- The New Zealand-DPRK Society issued a statement on August 27 in denunciation of the DPRK-targeted U.S.-south Korea joint military exercises.
					 The statement accused the U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces of staging the largest-ever joint military exercises throughout south Korea.
					
					 Another war exercises aimed at invading the DPRK increase the danger of war in the Korean Peninsula and compel the DPRK to bolster up its nuclear deterrent, it said.
					
					 Noting that the ceaseless large-scale war maneuvers of the U.S. and the south Korean authorities are further aggravating the regional situation, the statement urged them to stop the dangerous war maneuvers and the government of New Zealand to strive for peace in the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: Just Cause of Korean People Supported
articles.content:
Just Cause of Korean People Supported
 Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- The 1st meeting of the National Council of the African National Congress Youth League of South Africa, held on August 26, expressed full support for the Korean people's cause of justice.
					 Strongly condemning the U.S. belligerent policy, a vice-chairman of the league, said in a speech:
					
					 The U.S. is finding fault with the DPRK over its nuclear weapons while threatening it with nukes.
					
					 We hold that the nuclear issue of the Korean Peninsula should be solved fairly in view of peace and security.
					
					 The stand of the DPRK is just and fair.
					
					 The meeting sharply assailed the anti-DPRK moves of the U.S. and south Korean puppet clique, who recently cooked up the case of warship "Cheonan's" sinking to bring up the case for discussion at the UN and seek a permanent division while extremely aggravating the situation of the peninsula through provocative war exercises for aggression, and fully supported the independent politics of the DPRK and its stand for independent and peaceful reunification.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Songun Leadership Feats Lauded
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Songun Leadership Feats Lauded
Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- The British Branch of the Korean Friendship Association headquartered in Spain released a statement on August 25 on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's start of the Songun revolutionary leadership.
					 Noting that Kim Jong Il comprehensively formulated and systemized the Songun revolutionary theory and has applied it to practice, the statement said that the DPRK would have been despoiled of its sovereignty by the U.S. imperialists long ago but for his Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					 It stressed that the DPRK remains undaunted though the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet authorities are getting evermore undisguised in their moves for aggression against it after the fabrication of the case of warship "Cheonan".
					
					 This is a brilliant fruition of the five decades-long Songun revolutionary leadership of Kim Jong Il, the statement added.
					
					 On the same day Harising Khang, member of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of India (Marxist), and Saber Ballul, department head of the Political Faculty of University of Damascus in Syria, too, made public statements praising Kim Jong Il's Songun revolutionary leadership feats.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Off Press in Egypt
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Off Press in Egypt
Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "Songun-based Revolutionary Line Is a Great Revolutionary Line of Our Era and an Ever-Victorious Banner of Our Revolution" was brought out in booklet by a publishing house of Egypt on August 25. 
					The work, published on Jan. 29, Juche 92 (2003), clarifies the idea that the Songun revolutionary line, the Songun politics of the Workers' Party of Korea, is a powerful political mode in the present era which carried forward and developed President Kim Il Sung's idea and line of giving importance to the army and a scientific revolutionary line and political mode that most correctly reflected the requirements of the times and the revolution. It also refers to the validity and advantages of the Songun politics and its great vitality.

articles.title: Reuniones de delegados de provincias de Jagang y Ryanggang del PTC
articles.content:
Reuniones de delegados de provincias de Jagang y Ryanggang del PTC
 Pyongyang, 3 de septiembre (ATCC) -- Segun el diario Rodong Sinmun fechado 3, tuvieron lugar el 28 de agosto las reuniones de delegados del partido de las provincias de Jagang y Ryanggang para elegir a los delegados a la Conferencia del Partido del Trabajo de Corea.
					 En las ocasiones participaron los delegados elegidos en los comites provinciales, urbanos y distritales del partido y las organizaciones partidistas de las unidades a todos los niveles.
					
					 La agenda fue el problema de elegir a los delegados a la Conferencia del PTC.
					
					 Los discursos de propuesta estuvieron a cargo del secretario del Comite del PTC en la provincia de Jagang, Kim Chun Sop, quien es delegado de la organizacion del partido dentro del mismo comite provincial, y el secretario responsable del Comite del PTC en la provincia de Ryanggang, Kim Hi Thaek, quien es delegado de la organizacion del partido del Comite Popular de la misma provincia, respectivamente. 
					
					 Los oradores alabaron que el Dirigente Kim Jong Il es el maximo representante del PTC, simbolo de la dignidad y gloria de la patria y la nacion y bandera de todas las victorias del ejercito y el pueblo de Corea y agregaron que al conducir durante largo tiempo a la victoria el PTC y la revolucion coreana, el Dirigente realizo las proezas a ser transmitidas eternamente en la historia de la nacion de          Kim Il Sung. 
					
					 Al presentar el gran proyecto de construir una gran potencia prospera socialista, el Dirigente recorrio todas partes del pais con su espiritu indoblegable, voluntad superhumana y la marcha forzada al estilo guerrillero escribiendo la epopeya de abnegacion patriotica, apuntaron.
					
					 Bajo la guia del Dirigente, los antiguos campos de batallas revolucionarias y los lugares de interes historico-revolucionario han sido acondicionados magnificamente y contribuyen activamente a la educacion en las tradiciones revolucionarias, dijeron. Ademas, se construyen muchas centrales hidroelectricas medianas y pequenas y se levantan por doquier las fabricas de industria ligera que contribuyen a la mejora de la vida del pueblo, senalaron.
					
					 Propusieron cortesmente elegir al Dirigente como delegado a la Conferencia del PTC, en reflejo del unanime deseo de todos los militantes del partido y los habitantes de sus respectivas provincias.
					
					Los que intervinieron seguidamente apoyaron y aprobaron totalmente esa propuesta. 
					
					Luego, fue aprobada por unanimidad la resolucion correspondiente.

articles.title: Inaugurada galeria nacional con motivo de efemerides coreanas
articles.content:
Inaugurada galeria nacional con motivo de efemerides coreanas
Pyongyang, 3 de septiembre (ATCC) -- Quedo inaugurada este viernes en el Palacio de Deportes de Pyongyang la galeria nacional dedicada a la Conferencia del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y al 65o aniversario de la fundacion de este partido.
					Fueron expuestas en la ocasion mas de 400 piezas como las pinturas al estilo coreano, las al oleo, las esculturas, las hechas con piedras preciosas, los productos artesanales, los bordados y las obras caligraficas que muestran las grandes proezas revolucionarias de los grandes hombres sin iguales del monte Paektu registradas en los sagrados anales del PTC, y la lucha heroica del ejercito y el pueblo coreanos quienes vinieron creando milagros y meritos uniendose firmemente en torno al partido.
					
					La escultura "Gran Lider proclamando la fundacion del partido", la pintura al estilo coreano "Presentando como duenos de Hwangchol (Complejo Siderurgico Hwanghae)" y otras reflejan las imborrables hazanas del Presidente Kim Il Sung realizadas en la construccion del partido y sus nobles cualidades populares.
					
					Se ven tambien las pinturas al estilo coreano y al oleo y otras obras que dan a conocer la noble personalidad del Dirigente Kim Jong Il quien fortalecio el PTC como poderoso Estado Mayor de la revolucion y verdadero partido madre y formo al EPC como un invencible ejercito del monte Paektu, y las nobles cualidades de la Heroina de la Lucha Antijaponesa Kim Jong Suk quien dedico todo lo suyo por la patria y el pueblo.
					
					En algunas obras estan reflejadas la lucha de los militares y habitantes que avanzan a todo galope produciendo grandes innovaciones y saltos para construir cuanto antes la gran potencia prospera del Juche, y la feliz vida del pueblo que disfruta en el regazo del partido de todas las felicidades provenientes del socialismo.
					
					Estuvieron presentes en la ceremonia de apertura el secretario del Comite Central del PTC, Kim Ki Nam, el vicepremier del Consejo de Ministros Kang Nung Su, el ministro de Cultura An Tong Chun y otros funcionarios, los creadores de bellas artes, trabajadores jovenes y estudiantes capitalinos.
					
					El discurso de la ocasion estuvo a cargo de Kim Ki Nam.
					
					Los participantes recorrieron las obras exhibidas.

articles.title: Minju Joson comenta la reforma del gabinete surcoreano
articles.content:
Minju Joson comenta la reforma del gabinete surcoreano
Pyongyang, 3 de septiembre (ATCC) -- Al refrescar hace poco el equipo de gabinete, el traidor surcoreano Lee Myung Bak mantuvo en sus cargos a Hyon In Thaek, ministro de Reunificacion, Ryu Myong Hwan, ministro de Relaciones Exteriores y de Comercio, Kim Thae Yong, ministro de Defensa Nacional y Won Se Hun, director del Servicio de Inteligencia Nacional, condenados por toda la nacion como "4 traidores de 2010",
					  Esto demuestra la ambicion del traidor Lee de seguir en el camino de dependencia de las fuerzas foraneas y enfrentamiento fratricida.
					
					  Asi senala el periodico Minju Joson en un comentario individual del dia 3 y continua:
					
					  El traidor Lee dijo que la reforma gubernamental es para facilitar mas la "comunicacion con el pueblo", lo cual no paso de ser una mentira pura para enganar la opinion publica.
					
					  Son corruptos sin excepcion alguna todos los nuevos integrantes del gabinete.
					
					  La "comunicacion con el pueblo" aludida por Lee significa el egocentrismo y la arbitrariedad contrariados a la voluntad del pueblo.
					
					  Lo mas grave del caso es que Lee Myung Bak dijo hipocritamente a sus nuevos subalternos que se pusieron al frente en construir una "sociedad equitativa".
					
					  Claro esta que esos tipejos corruptos no pueden ni quieren construir una sociedad equitativa.
					
					  Lo que persigue Lee es calmar, por una parte, al indignado pueblo surcoreano con las palabras como "comunicacion con el pueblo" y "sociedad equitativa" y por la otra, seguir practicando, en lo que resta de su mandato, su politica antipopular y emprendiendo el camino de dependencia de las fuerzas extranjeras y enfrentamiento fratricida contando con los nuevos subalternos. 
					
					Esta camarilla de traidores sera enjuiciada severamente por el pueblo en un futuro no lejano.

articles.title: Descubierta en Corea nueva tumba de Coguryo
articles.content:
Descubierta en Corea nueva tumba de Coguryo
						
Pyongyang, 3 de septiembre (ATCC) -- Recientemente, los investigadores del Instituto de Arqueologia de la Academia de Ciencias Sociales de Corea encontraron en el barrio de Tongsan del capitalino municipio de Rangnang una tumba con la pintura al fresco de Coguryo, que segun estimaciones, pertenece al periodo entre finales del siglo 4 y comienzos del siglo 5.
					Esta tumba de arcilla extendida del norte al sur tiene 12.8m de largo y 2-2.4m de ancho y dentro de ella, hay una via, las camaras delantera, izquierda y derecha y la interior, un pasillo, etc.
					
					La camara delantera tiene 240cm de largo, 210cm de ancho y 330cm de alto y las de ambos lados tienen 80cm de largo, 72cm de ancho y 115cm de alto.
					
					En la tumba fueron hallados los huesos de 3 personas, los adornos en forma de hoja de flor y hemisferio hechos con el oro puro, el otro de plata en forma de circulo, los objetos decorativos de oro y cobre en forma serrada, los clavos de ataud, las lozas, la porcelana de verdeceladon en forma de leon, las monedas de cobre, etc.
					
					En ambas paredes de la via interior estan esculpidos el dibujo de la caravana de aristocratas, y en las paredes de la camara delantera, el pasillo y la camara interior, la columna roja, el general portero y otros estampados.
					
					En la parte superior del dibujo de la caravana se ven 5 personas y 4 caballos y en la parte media estan el cuerpo y las piernas de un caballo acorazado, sobre el cual se ve un poco la cabeza de un hombre.
					
					En la parte abajo estan dibujados unos hombres en capuchas negras empunando algo parecido a la lanza larga.
					
					En la pared al oeste de la via interior se ven la rueda de carro y un jinete.
					
					Lo peculiar de esta tumba es que su tumulo se ha hecho alternando las capas de la cal, carbon de lena y arcilla.
					
					Ella tiene un tamano relativamente grande y una estructura peculiar entre las otras tumbas con la pintura al fresco de Coguryo exploradas hasta la fecha.
